intro: Endlicheria bracteolata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous environments, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Its leaves are broad and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are woody and can become branched with age. Endlicheria bracteolata is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
